text: When you see how much time is left for a task, how strongly do you feel stress or panic?

I hate weekdays.
I used to experience a steady flow in my daily activities, but now it feels more chaotic
I need more sleep than I used to.
I feel energetic in the morning after my first coffee.
I often check whether I have enough time for a task before starting it.
Sometimes I’m scared to look at the time.
Time pressure makes it harder for me to think clearly.
Deadlines make me more focused rather than more stressed.
I usually notice when I’m running behind before it becomes a problem.

When I see a chaotic or cluttered desk, I feel uncomfortable.

I often hear people without really processing what they are saying.

Sometimes I feel like the walls are closing in on me.
When the phone rings, I often think something bad happened.
I can get so deep into what I’m doing that I feel disconnected from the outside world.

I don’t panic easily.

How many times did you pause to question why you reacted the way you did?

How many times did you feel pulled between who you are and who you think you should be?
How many times did you question whether you are living in a way that feels true to you?
I often feel like I’m harder on myself than other people are.
I feel responsible for making my life turn out well.
I sometimes feel disconnected from who I really am.
I believe my reactions usually make sense given my experiences.
I often feel torn between what I want and what I think I should want.
I feel comfortable with who I am, even when things aren’t going well.
I often question whether I’m living the right kind of life.
I feel free to be myself without constantly adjusting to others.
I feel that my life has a direction, even if it’s not fully clear yet.
I think these questions will help me
